full_summary:
**Government Tender Announcement: Construction Services for CFB Esquimalt**
====================================================================

**Tender Details**
----------------

*   **Tender Title**: Open Construction Source List (OCSL) for CFB Esquimalt, BC
*   **Solicitation Number**: PR22SLPE
*   **Publication Date**: December 5, 2022
*   **Tender Closing Date**: March 31, 2026, at 7:00 PM Pacific Time

**Purpose**
----------

The Department of National Defence is inviting contractors and suppliers to apply for inclusion in the Open Construction Source List (OCSL) for commercial, residential, industrial, institutional, and civil work required at CFB Esquimalt, British Columbia. This list will be used for tenders with an estimated value of $10 million and below.

**Application Process**
-------------------

Interested contractors and suppliers may submit an application to be placed on the OCSL at any time. However, Defence Construction Canada (DCC) recommends submitting applications as soon as possible, preferably by January 15, 2023. Applications will be processed within 10 business days.

**Language**
----------

Contractors and suppliers must specify their preferred official language (English or French) when submitting their application. The selected language will be used for all tender documents, contract documents, and communication for future tenders and contracts.

**Security Requirements**
----------------------

Some contracts under this OCSL may require organization and personnel security clearances. Contractors and suppliers who have not previously held clearance may need to begin the sponsorship request process. DCC may publish quarterly Advance Procurement Notices (APNs) with potential security requirements to provide interested contractors with an opportunity to begin the sponsorship request process.

**Tender Process**
----------------

DCC will use electronic bidding through MERX for tenders under this OCSL. Contractors and suppliers who are placed on the OCSL will receive an invitation to bid electronically. Prior to closing, DCC may require a site meeting, which will be announced separately.

**Contract Award**
-----------------

The contract award is subject to Defence Construction Canada's Procurement Code of Conduct and applicable legislation. Contractors and suppliers who receive an unacceptable or failing performance evaluation may be removed from the OCSL.

**References**
------------

*   **Notice URL**: [https://www.merx.com/public/solicitations/2355440456/abstract?language=EN](https://www.merx.com/public/solicitations/235544
